Fer years///back1nMyD@y

First I memorized every nook and cranny of every map with hungry eyes. (It's called Noclip).
Then I Started crowning Witches (Blowing Special Zombie Class in the skull that could kill you with one fingernail)
Finally I carried Molotovs for Tanks (Bullet Sponge Wrestler zombie)

Next thing I knew I was noscoping Smokers, Boomers, and Bashing Hunters middair. Going IRL to a Shotgun class with my Pappy n' Granpappy noscoping Clay Pellets.

I guess somewhere along those lines I was charging through campaigns on Legendary with my friends or something?

I am not entirely sure.

[h1] О, какая замечательная картина! Одинокий домик посреди леса. Я знаю, как заканчиваются такие фильмы... [/h1]

[i] Всем при-при-привеет, сегодня, напишу обзор на первую часть L4D, ну-с... Начнём :)[/i]

[h1] Что такое Left 4 Dead? [/h1]
Не хотелось делать похожим мой обзор со второй частью, но придётся кое-где повторяться.
[code] Друг познаётся в беде. [/code]
Наверное, вот что стоить знать, играя в эту игру.

Моя первая часть - это, очень странно конечно, но вторая :D.
Обидно было узнать, не пройдя первую часть что (Супер-мега спойлер!!!) [spoiler] Умрёт Билл, мой любимый персонаж :С [/spoiler]

[i] Обзор короткий, по причине, что у меня есть огромный обзор L4D2, поэтому, если интересно, можете посмотреть. :) [/i]

[u] ✔ и ✖ [/u]

[u]  ✔  [/u]
[list]
    [*]Отличный как и мультиплеер, так и одиночная компания.
    [*]Отличная русская озвучка, и перевод.
    [*]Имеются комментарии разработичков.
    [*]Не смотря на свою однообразность, игра не надоедает.
[/list]

[u] ✖ [/u]
[list]
    [*]Нет ближнего оружия. (Зато, его добавили во вторую часть:))
    [*]Очень мало миссий. (Но, они не надоедают)
    [*]Довольно странное коммьюнити. (Могут кикнуть за то,что ты их лечишь при том, что у них 5хп :D)
[/list]

[i] Всех благодарю за прочтение обзора ❤, если скучно, заходи в нашу группу, там ссылка на наш дискорд, ну и ещё, я уже куратор Стима, всем спасибо за поддержку!)  [/i]

Left 4 Dead was released in 2008 at the height of the pop culture zombie craze of the mid 2000s to early 2010s. Of the hundreds upon hundreds of zombie games released during that time, Left 4 Dead is arguably among the best.

The events of Left 4 Dead take place shortly after the collapse of society in the wake of a presumably global epidemic. The plague responsible for the game's setting does not revive the dead and turn them into shambling enemies as seen in films such as Night of the Living Dead - the grandfather of all zombie media - or in games such as No More Room In Hell. Instead the plague infects living individuals and causes extreme aggression, speed, and occasional mutation. Due to this, Left 4 Dead's plague is much more similar to the Rage Virus in the film 28 Days Later. As a result, Left 4 Dead doesn't feature "zombies" in the traditional sense but instead uses the word "infected" to describe its antagonists.

Left 4 Dead sets itself apart from other games in the zombie sub-genre largely with it's highly encouraged cooperative nature. Many zombie games will have the player attempt to survive the apocalypse alone, while others will have cooperative gameplay that only half-heartedly encourages players to assist each other - if that much. Left 4 Dead, meanwhile, uses game mechanics in the form of mutated special infected enemies to force players to stick together. The smoker enemy, for example, can easily grab a lone survivor with it's long tongue and incapacitate them in a matter of seconds. The hunter enemy, likewise, can pounce and then disembowel an isolated player with ease. Meanwhile, the boomer can vomit bile onto a player, summoning the surrounding common infected horde. These enemies make typically lone-wolf players stick close to and protect their teammates with a surprising degree of effectiveness.

In terms of gameplay, the action is fast and haste when moving through a level is recommended, especially at higher difficulties due to periodically spawning special infected - such as the aforementioned smoker, hunter, and boomer - and hordes of common infected. In addition to these enemies, there are two rarer special infected: the witch and the tank - both requiring different strategies to deal with. The witch is usually heard before she is seen - indicated by the telltale sounds of crying. Generally, stealth and careful maneuvering is most desirable when dealing with the witch since she can instantly kill a player on the hardest difficulty level. Meanwhile, the tank - a hulking mass of a zombie - requires a great deal of running and gunning to take down effectively due to his immense strength and endurance.

Weapon-wise, there are a handful of choices available which each suit different playstyles. At earlier chapters of each campaign, two "tier 1" weapons are available: the fast firing submachine gun and the slower, but deadlier at close range, pump shotgun. Later in each campaign, "tier 2" weapons become available such as the auto shotgun (an upgraded version of the pump shotgun), an assault rifle (an improvement over the submachine gun), and the hunting rifle - useful due to its high level of accuracy and ability to shoot through multiple enemies at once. Additionally, at all stages of the campaign, an M1911 pistol sidearm can be used and even be dual wielded. These weapon options allow players to fullfill different roles in their team, though it is perfectly viable for all four members to select the same weapon type.

For game modes, there are four main types available: single-player campaign, which teams you up with ai-controlled players; campaign, which teams you up with human players; versus, which pits human controlled survivors against human controlled special infected; and survival, which is a time-trial mode.

As for the game's campaigns, there are six available in campaign and versus mode, with a seventh available in survival" mode. No Mercy starts you off in the gloomy overrun city of Fairfield with you trying to make your way to Mercy Hospital. Crash Course, a shorter campaign, involves you traveling through the alleys of a small town in order to find a armored truck suitable for transporting you. In Death Toll you traverse tunnels, sewers, and a suburban area in order to find refuge with a boat. Dead Air has you navigate to and through an airport crawling with infected. Blood Harvest takes place in a rural forest and farm setting. Finally, the Sacrifice has you navigate a coastal area in order to hopefully find a sailboat. Overall, all of the campaigns are varied and have a distinct theme and identity, making each one unique in its own way. Notably, in contrast to Left 4 Dead's sequel, all of the campaigns are very gloomy in tone with muted colors and an overall very spooky vibe - whether players like this or not is largely down to personal preference.

Finally, for the game's protagonists, you can choose from one of four survivors for a given campaign: Bill, Francis, Louis, and Zoey. Bill is the grizzled aging Vietnam veteran sporting a green beret and a cigarette; Francis is the tatoo-covered, vest-loving, wise-cracking biker; Louis is the upbeat and perpetually optimistic doctor; and Zoey is the former college student and zombie film buff. All of the characters have distinct personalities developed well through their dialogues with each other during the game's campaigns. While each have completely identical stats and attributes, making each equally viable, players often gravitate towards a particular character due to their appearance or personality.

Overall, Left 4 Dead is a well-developed and fleshed-out game. It is often on sale for a couple dollars, and for that price it is hard not to recommend it. However, there are a couple points that need to be addressed. Firstly, this game's sequel Left 4 Dead 2 contains ALL of the original game's content in addition to more campaigns, weapons, and special infected. For that reason I would recommend buying Left 4 Dead 2 instead of the original, as you will essentially be buying an improved version of this game. Secondly, Left 4 Dead 2 has a generally more active playerbase with more players online at any given time, meaning it is usually easier to find a game. Furthermore, Left 4 Dead 2, based on my experiences, has slightly fewer instances of trolling, griefing, and team-killing, though your mileage will vary here. Regardless, Left 4 Dead is a very good game in its genre and if you ignore the presence of its sequel, it is absolutely a game I can recommend.

tl;dr: Left 4 Dead good, Left 4 Dead 2 better. If you can buy only one, get Left 4 Dead 2.
